You are given a line of $n$ people, each with a unique ID from 1 to $n$.  At each step, anyone with a higher ID than the person to their right will kill that person.  If a person is killed, they are removed from the line.

Your task is to determine the minimum number of steps it takes for the line to stabilize, meaning no one kills anyone else in the next step.

You are given a line of numbered people. Each person with a higher number than the person to their right can eliminate that person.  This happens simultaneously.  Find the fewest steps it takes for no one to be able to eliminate anyone else.
